description: Woking come from behind to beat Oldham and move six points clear of the National League relegation zone.
title: Oldham Athletic 1-2 Woking
maintext:
Woking came from behind to beat Oldham and move six points clear of the National League relegation zone.
The fourth-placed Latics, who have ambitions at the other end of the table, failed to take advantage of the third-minute lead given to them when Kian Harratt converted a rebound from Mike Fondop's shot.
But Woking launched a fightback after the break with Dion Kelly-Evans heading home his first goal of the season from Lewis Walker's cross to the far post, four minutes after the break.
Walker then made it two goals in as many games by lobbing goalkeeper Mathew Hudson in the 58th minute to secure only a second win in nine league matches.
